One year ago today: #StaffsSUNRISE broke ground and began the creation of our new river channel at @stokecity's old Victoria Ground. 
What a difference a year makes! 
Thanks to our partners/supporters on this project: @EnvAgencyMids @SoTCityCouncil @WildTroutTrust @StModwen https://t.co/h8QvZsuGQ1

tweets.text: @PJennings88 @RiverChess @EnvAgency surely it is illegal to discharge sewage into a globally rare chalkstream unless in exceptional circumstances, such as very heavy rainfall? No doubt as guardians of the environment you‚Äôll be investigating this with alacrity.

@watervole3 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @joe_crowley @RachSalv @leanahosea @WindrushWasp @pow_rebecca @thameswater @SalmonTroutCons Storm tanks spill when they are full. They can only be emptied, and at a low rate, when the receiving flow into the STW is low enough to prevent short circuiting back into the storm tanks. In wet weather this often means full tanks immediately start spilling during a storm.

A warning to the public the @RiverChess is back to daily sewage discharges. We advise caution, avoid contact with river water for you and your pets.

How's that working out then?
